content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can create a function named `clean_column` as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)

    # Replace spaces, hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"([-]| )+(?=[A-Z][a-z0-9])", "_")

    # Return the cleaned column name
    return col
end
```

This function accepts a string as an argument and cleans it according to your requirements. You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column(" Another column with spaces _ and - ")
"another_column_with_spaces_and_-"
```
